doc:
Eve Arden https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eve_Arden 0 Eve Arden (born Eunice Mary Quedens, April 30, 1908 – November 12, 1990) was an American film, radio, stage, and television actress, and comedian. She performed in leading and supporting roles for nearly six decades. Beginning her career on Broadway in the early 1930s, Arden's first major role was in the RKO Radio Pictures drama Stage Door (1937) opposite Katharine Hepburn, followed by roles in the comedies Having Wonderful Time (1938) and the Marx Brothers' At the Circus (1939). Arden would go on to earn an Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actress for her role in Mildred Pierce (1945). In the latter part of her career, she played the sardonic but engaging title character of a high school teacher in Our Miss Brooks, winning the first Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series, and as the school principal in the musicals Grease (1978) and Grease 2 (1982). Eve_Arden ( born Eunice_Mary_Quedens , April_30_,_1908 – November_12_,_1990 ) was an_American_film , radio , stage , and television_actress , and comedian . She performed in leading_and_supporting_roles for nearly_six_decades . Beginning her_career on Broadway in the_early_1930s , Arden 's_first_major_role was in the_RKO_Radio_Pictures_drama_Stage_Door_(_1937_)_opposite_Katharine_Hepburn , followed by roles in the_comedies Having Wonderful_Time_(_1938_) and the_Marx_Brothers_' At the_Circus_(_1939_) . Arden would_go on to_earn an_Academy_Award_nomination for Best_Supporting_Actress for her_role in Mildred_Pierce_(_1945_) . In the_latter_part of her_career , she played the_sardonic_but_engaging_title_character of a_high_school_teacher in Our_Miss_Brooks , winning the_first_Primetime_Emmy_Award for Outstanding_Lead_Actress in a_Drama_Series , and as the_school_principal in the_musicals_Grease ( 1978_)_and_Grease_2_(_1982_) .
